Even before I had him hook up with Optima he's been making Decepticon babies behind my back. Imagine my surprise when I started up his household and found that he had shacked up with some random blonde and had a toddler! For shame, Megatron. For shame.
now I want to make a Praxian household, with a teenage Bluestreak and young adults Prowl and Smokescreen. Screenshots coming up in a bit of Optima and Megatron.

Your result for The Golden Compass Daemon Test...

Multi-Faceted Soul

In a way, you are a truly balanced person. You have a good sense of self, but you have periods of worry and self doubt. You don't like to be alone a lot, but you don't like being constantly surrounded, either. You can be shy in some situations and bold in others. You can tell people how you feel, but you don't wear your heart on your sleeve. You aren't "TOO" anything: You aren't too shy, you aren't too aggressive, you aren't too extroverted, you aren't too introverted. However at any one time you can be any combination of these things.

You tend to adapt yourself to match the situations in which you find yourself. You may be quiet and sensitive with some people, or joking and loud with others. These are all facets of your personality. People tend to perceive you as they want to perceive you. They may even tend to idealize you a bit. Then, when you do something that doesn't fit their concept of who you are (like have an outburst of anger, or a fit of shyness, or make an insensitive joke)they can be shocked and surprised. Does anyone know the real you?

Your daemon would represent your multi-faceted and ever-changing personality, as well as people's tendency to idealize you. He or she would get angry when you did not, be calm and poised when you felt ruffled and anxious, and always be the voice of emotion and reason in your ear.

Suggested forms: Swan, Elephant, Koala, Panda, Chameleon, Wolf.

Take The Golden Compass Daemon Test at HelloQuizzy

So I've been watching Ghost Adventures and I know I would LOVE to go on a lockdown with these dudes. I want to see if what they see and hear is real and not just exaggeration for the camera. I've veeeeeeeeeery skeptical about ghosts existing but I would like to see one, ya know?

So I think I just got an epiphany about why I keep thinking about sex. It's not the orgasm, it's the emotional closeness I can experience with someone, the joy in giving and receiving pleasure, the knowledge that someone wants me enough to not care what my body looks like. And it's because of this I know that I cannot ever have one-night stands, because I will invest too much of my self and emotional stability into it.

On the other, this godiva chocolate cheesecake was deliciouussssss.

So, due to my happiness that F.3.A.R is coming out this year, and my fangirlishness over the games, I was hit with a rather morbid bunny and sat down to write it all down in one go. Warning: it's weird and it's not proof-read. And it might not make sense. Oh well!

Spoilers for F.E.A.R. 2
Title: ?
Characters: Beckett, Alma
Rating: R

At times he managed to break free of her hold. He would open his eyes, gasping, to see the closed dome over his head, the dim emergency lights. The skin on his wrists rubbed raw as he bucked desperately in the metal chair, trying to get free. He would gather his muddy, hate-stained thoughts, try to brush away the memory of cold, dead eyes and long dark hair.

The air inside the dome stank of sweat and terror, but at the very least it wasn't the acrid scent of ash and fire, the cloying copper of spilled blood. Alma carried that scent around like a shroud. The man in the chair would plan, gaze desperately about to see if their was an inside switch he could reach with his shaking fingers, his stretched out foot.. maybe.. maybe....

But then Alma would take him again, drag him into her world where everything was the red of fire and blood, charred landscapes and skeletal buildings the only thing she saw. At least he could walk, could move about, but she was always there, watching. A thin white figure in the corner of his eye.

In this world, the horror at the sight of her pregnant belly on a body that was at times corpse-like, emaciated, at other times youthful and alive, was mercifully dim. The rage and hate and terrible sadness filling the air was now a background noise. He could even stand the sight of her for longer periods of time.

He would sleep, or what passed for it, and wake up to sometimes find his head in her lap, her fingers toying with his hair with a childlike fascination. Once or twice she would rest his cheek against her belly so he could hear the faint whispers of his child inside her womb, a strangely innocent abomination with a mother who would destroy the entire world as vengeance for what they did to her.

Other times, terrifying, nauseating, she would push him down, not listening to his strangled whispers of "No, Alma. No..." Her soft, childlike gasps would mix with his stifled noises of terror. She was silent in release; he would cry out in horror.

Where was the strong and silent soldier? Where was the confident man who would calmly and coldly put a bullet in the heads of scientific abominations and mind-controlled soldiers? Where was the man who would run silently through halls streaked with blood and broken glass, reflexes in battle making him nothing more than a blur to his enemies?

Where was the man who was once called Sargeant Beckett?

***

A dull clanking and a deep hum woke him. The dome was opening. He could hear the static of radio communication and the harsh voices of hurried men. Light blinded him.

"Holy God, he's still alive."

He tried to speak, but nothing came out but a hoarse whisper. He might've said "Help me," but it was buried under the noise. Hands touched him and he flinched strongly, expecting ice-cold skeletal fingers instead of sturdy, male hands.

"Easy now, you're safe."

No, not safe. She'll find me... she'll kill you. Run. Run.

They did not listen. They pulled him out of his damned prison, the shell in which he'd screamed until his voice died. A black heartbeat pulsed behind his eyes.

"Run, run," he whispered as he was slung over someone's back. No stretcher; they needed all the hands that could carry a gun available. The lights seemed to dim, and one man gasped in fear.

"Don't look back," the man in charge snapped. He was the one who carried him. "Keep going."

Beckett faded in an out of consciousness. He would wake to hear gunfire and screaming, the harsh pants of his savior as he ran through concrete halls. Red sticky warmth slid down his cheek, and he saw the blasted carcass of what used to be a human being sliding down the far wall.

Come back, she whispered in his ear. He moaned in terror. "Stay with me, Beckett," the man holding him grunted. Ahead, there was sunlight.

Another man screamed and died, voice wrenching into a fluid-filled gurgle.

The motley group burst into daylight, high noon striking Beckett blind once more. Dust stung him, dull whup whup whup of a military helicopter drowning out an angry female shriek. More hands grabbed him, pulled him on board.

Don't leave me.

The ground quickly fell away, and through the open side he saw her standing there, a corpse-white figure with sad, sad eyes. Despite himself, he reached out to her, a weak lift of his hand. She had lost so much already....

As a psychic wail of rage and loss sliced through the minds of the men in the helicopter, Beckett fell into darkness, the last thing he heard was her voice.

Michael...

Fandom: Harry Potter

Pairing: Harry/Ginny

Rating: G

 

 

Ginny heard when Harry came home. Sleepy brown eyes opened immediately at the slight creak of their bedroom door, her red hair partly obscuring the sight of the baby’s crib next to their bed. She listened to the soft rustling behind her as her husband removed his robe as quietly as he could, but Ginny did not turn around to acknowledge him. The stars and planets suspended above their child’s crib spun silently, casting very faint sparkles across the cream-colored walls.

Usually Ginny stayed up all night if she had to, waiting to see when and if Harry came home safe from one of his assignments, but the memory of their harsh argument over the dinner table spun harshly in her mind. A cold, helpless claw had squeezed her chest and stopped the barbed words right in her throat at the stricken look on her husband's face, and she had retreated to the den with little James to leave Harry standing in the kitchen, emerald eyes weary behind his glasses. He'd left their home for the first time without Ginny seeing him off.

Now, with sleepless hours available to stew in her own anger and subsequent crushing regret, Ginny cursed herself for not having the courage to turn around and apologize. She scowled fiercely at nothing, slender body jostling softly as the mattress dipped under Harry's weight as the man slid carefully into bed.

Silence reigned. After a while, when Ginny thought that Harry had fallen asleep, a cautious, weary arm carefully encircled her waist. A warm forehead pressed itself to the back of her neck and Harry breathed in, infinitely tired. Ginny closed her eyes, finally allowing herself to feel the sheer relief that her husband was safe for another night.
She turned around, the only sound in the room the soft rustling of sheets and quiet breathing as Ginny thumbed her love's cheekbone, forehead against forehead, black and red locks entwining. I'm sorry said her hands and body as she pressed closer.

Harry's answer was to gather her close, accepting her apology with a silent sigh.

A miniature comet curved its slow majestic way across the solar system above little James, gentle blue light bathing the room in its benevolent glow.

hurr hurr

Basic Human Needs

Psychological Needs: food, drink, air, sleep, sex

Safety Needs: security, stability, protection, structure, orderliness, law, predictability, freedom from fear and chaos

Belongingness and Love Needs: love and affection with family, friends; acceptance and approval by social groups

Esteem Needs: Self-esteem from achievement, competence, mastery, confidence, reputation, recognition, status

Self-Actualization: self-fulfillment: to be what one can be.


Each category is a foundation for the next. If you do not have Safety, you can't exactly Belong someplace, if you do not have Safety and you don't Belong anywhere, then how can you feel Esteem? The point of this whole shebang is to map out where you are in this "ladder" of Basic Human Needs. For example, I am at the Belonging tier.

I'll explain.

Physical needs: I eat okay, I drink, I sleep when I need to, and I am confident in myself as a young woman and my sexuality (sex in this case pertains to your perception of your own sex, not happy fun tiemz). With this foundation I can go on to

Safety: my schedule at work and school is not erratic, I feel safe in the knowing that my life is on track for the moment, I feel secure with my family, and I know that I can always depend on them for any help. Although finances are low, we are not out living in the street. With this other tier I can head on to

Belonging: my family and my friends love me, and I am not a social outcast. I have a place in this world.

I can't place myself in the Esteem tier because I am not confident in myself. I don't think of myself as a successful person. I am working to achieve this tier by graduating from college, then I can feel confident in knowing that I'm a smart woman and that I can work hard to achieve something successfully.

 Also, by graduating college, I can go all the way up to Self-Actualization where I reach the pinnacle of what I can be. Once the high wears off I'll go back to Esteem.

So. Where are you on this "ladder" of human needs? What do you need to reach the next tier?

This place is gorgeous! And the view is amazing! I will post pictures when we come back home on Monday. Tomorrow I shall spend the time to write out the x-mas drabbles on this battered old notebook I brought with me. If it wasn't going to be so cold tomorrow I would sit out on the deck and enjoy the view over the valley while rocking on the deck chair like an old soul and just write. I will guiltily admit that I've been working on this one-shot/plot bunny concerning Bluestreak instead of yall's drabbles 8D;. Me and Sam did an rp with him once, and I just wanted to work on it a little bit more. I may probably not expand upon it, so the plot bunny is up for adoption.

Me and the family have been spending time in a cabin perched on the edge of a mountain overlooking Wears Valley. The fireplace is almost always lit, and the view is beautiful whether the sky is clear or cloudy. The clouds casting shadows over the contours and dips of the rolling hills is mesmerizing.

I want to go back during fall, because I just know that this place will be extra beautiful with the riot of gold, red, greens, and earthy and earthy browns. Walking in Gatlinburg is fun with all the tourist trap shops. I bought a silver ring as a souvenir.

Me and the extended family (aunts, uncles, grandparents, cousins, toddlers and young children) took this tram up three-thousand feet up the Smoky Mountains (actually, I dunno the real height, I just know that it was waaaaaaaay up. THEN we took this chair lift to the very top of a peak. It was around 6,600 feet up in the air, and the view around was like.... woah. I'll post a pic of me and my bro sitting in the chair on Monday.

Man I wish I had a laptop -- this is my cousin's laptop I'm using.

Love y'all, I'll try to borrow this again sometime tomorrow so I can talk to y'all and stoof. bais!
Dad and Edwin need to come home from work so we can pack up the car and leeaaaaaaaaave.
